trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for connecting to SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for connecting to SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: To connect to SQL Data Warehouse you will need to pass in security credentials for authentication purposes.
trans-unit.target: To connect to SQL Data Warehouse you will need to pass in security credentials for authentication purposes.

trans-unit.source: Upon establishing a connection you will also find that certain connection settings are configured as part of establishing your query session.
trans-unit.target: Upon establishing a connection you will also find that certain connection settings are configured as part of establishing your query session.

trans-unit.source: This article details the following aspects of connecting to SQL Data warehouse:
trans-unit.target: This article details the following aspects of connecting to SQL Data warehouse:

trans-unit.source: To connect to SQL Data Warehouse you will need to provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: To connect to SQL Data Warehouse you will need to provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that users must authenticate using SQL authentication.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that users must authenticate using SQL authentication.

trans-unit.source: Trusted authentication is not supported at this time.
trans-unit.target: Trusted authentication is not supported at this time.

trans-unit.source: By default your connection will connect to the master database and not your user database.
trans-unit.target: By default your connection will connect to the master database and not your user database.

trans-unit.source: To connect to your user database you can choose to do one of two things:
trans-unit.target: To connect to your user database you can choose to do one of two things:

trans-unit.source: Specify the default database when registering your server with the SQL Server Object Explorer in SSDT or in your application connection string.
trans-unit.target: Specify the default database when registering your server with the SQL Server Object Explorer in SSDT or in your application connection string.

trans-unit.source: For example by including the InitialCatalog parameter for an ODBC connection.
trans-unit.target: For example by including the InitialCatalog parameter for an ODBC connection.

trans-unit.source: First highlight the user database prior to creating a session in SSDT.
trans-unit.target: First highlight the user database prior to creating a session in SSDT.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For guidance connecting to SQL Data Warehouse with SSDT please refer back to the [connect and query][] getting started article.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For guidance connecting to SQL Data Warehouse with SSDT please refer back to the [connect and query][] getting started article.

trans-unit.source: It is again important to note that the Transact-SQL statement **USE <your DB>** is not supported for changing the database for a connection
trans-unit.target: It is again important to note that the Transact-SQL statement **USE <your DB>** is not supported for changing the database for a connection

trans-unit.source: You can connect to SQL Data Warehouse using any of the following protocols:
trans-unit.target: You can connect to SQL Data Warehouse using any of the following protocols:

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse standardizes a few settings during connection and object creation.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse standardizes a few settings during connection and object creation.

trans-unit.source: Once a connection has been made and a session has been established you are ready to write and submit queries to SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Once a connection has been made and a session has been established you are ready to write and submit queries to SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Each query will be represented by one or more request identifiers.
trans-unit.target: Each query will be represented by one or more request identifiers.

trans-unit.source: All queries submitted on that connection are part of a single session and will therefore be represented by a single session id.
trans-unit.target: All queries submitted on that connection are part of a single session and will therefore be represented by a single session id.

trans-unit.source: However, as SQL Data Warehouse is a distributed MPP system both session and request identifiers are exposed a little differently when compared to SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: However, as SQL Data Warehouse is a distributed MPP system both session and request identifiers are exposed a little differently when compared to SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Sessions and requests are logically represented by their respective identifiers.
trans-unit.target: Sessions and requests are logically represented by their respective identifiers.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the Session ID is prefixed by SID - shorthand for Session ID - and the requests are prefixed by QID which is shorthand for Query ID.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the Session ID is prefixed by SID - shorthand for Session ID - and the requests are prefixed by QID which is shorthand for Query ID.

trans-unit.source: You will need this information to help you identify your query when monitoring your query performance.
trans-unit.target: You will need this information to help you identify your query when monitoring your query performance.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor your query performance by using either the [Azure Portal] and the dynamic management views.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor your query performance by using either the [Azure Portal] and the dynamic management views.

trans-unit.source: To identify which session you are currently using the following function:
trans-unit.target: To identify which session you are currently using the following function:

trans-unit.source: To view all the queries that are either running or have recently run against your data warehouse you can use a query like the one below:
trans-unit.target: To view all the queries that are either running or have recently run against your data warehouse you can use a query like the one below:

trans-unit.source: Note this query has been encapsulated in a view so that you can incorporate it into your solution.
trans-unit.target: Note this query has been encapsulated in a view so that you can incorporate it into your solution.

trans-unit.source: However to see the results you will need to create the view and execute it.
trans-unit.target: However to see the results you will need to create the view and execute it.

trans-unit.source: Once connected you can begin designing your tables.
trans-unit.target: Once connected you can begin designing your tables.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the [table design] article for further details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the [table design] article for further details.
